bill_title: prohibit the use of certain hand-held devices by motor vehicle drivers, to provide for certain exemptions, and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the use of certain hand-held devices by motor vehicle drivers, to provide for certain exemptions, and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. It is unlawful to operate a cellular telephone, computer, facsimile, or other portable or laptop device , while operating a motor vehicle, if the operation of the device requires holding the device, or a portion of the device, with one or both hands. The operator of a motor vehicle may use a cellular telephone, computer, facsimile, or other portable or laptop device if the device is equipped with a hands-free feature such as a speaker system, number storage, or voice recognition if the operator of the motor vehicle exercises a high degree of caution in the operation of the motor vehicle. The operator of a motor vehicle may use a cellular telephone, computer, facsimile, or other portable or laptop device that is not equipped with a hands-free feature only if: (1) The person is operating an emergency or mass transit vehicle and the operation of that device is required during the course of the operation of that vehicle; or (2) The operator of the motor vehicle has safely removed the vehicle out of the stream of traffic to the shoulder of a highway or other safe area off the highway and brought the vehicle to a complete stop; or (3) The operator of the motor vehicle is involved in any emergency, observes an emergency situation, or observes the operator of another motor vehicle driving in a reckless, negligent, or dangerous manner or apparently driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs, and the use of that device is necessary to report that emergency or observation to appropriate authorities. Section 2. Nothing in this Act prevents any passenger or occupant of a motor vehicle, other than the operator, from using a hand-held cellular telephone, computer, facsimile, or other portable or laptop device while the motor vehicle is in motion. Section 3. Any person who violates section 1 of this Act is guilty of a petty offense pursuant to the provisions of chapter 23-1A.
